0.title: CPU usage

1.title: Memory usage

2.title: Network IO
2.query:
timeseries avg(system.network.io), by: { host.name }, filter: { matchesValue(host.name, $Hosts) }
| fieldsAdd NetworkIO = arrayAvg(`avg(system.network.io)`)

3.title: Filesystem usage (root)

4.title: CPU usage

5.title: CPU usage per process

6.title: OS Type

7.title: Memory usage per process
7.query:
timeseries {
  usage = avg(process.memory.usage)
},
by: { process.command_line, host.name, process.pid },
filter: { host.name == $Hosts },
from: -2m, to: -1m
| fieldsAdd memory = arrayLast(usage)
| fieldsRemove host.name, usage
| sort memory desc

8.title: Memory usage
8.query:
timeseries utilization = avg(system.memory.usage),
filter: { host.name == $Hosts and state == "used"}

11.title: Paging usage

13.title: Logical CPUs

14.title: OS Arch

15.title: Memory

16.title: Filesystem capacity (root)

18.title: Physical CPUs

19.content:
# OpenTelemetry Host Dashboard

Follow the [GitHub Documentation](https://github.com/Dynatrace/dynatrace-otel-collector/blob/main/docs/dashboards/Host%20Dashboard.md) how to configure the Hostmetrics receiver and [allowed metric attributes](/ui/apps/dynatrace.classic.settings/ui/settings/builtin:opentelemetry-metrics?gtf=-2h&gf=all) on your Dynatrace Tenant. Note that the dashboard won't include any alerts by default. To configure alerts, use [Davis® Anomaly Detection](/ui/apps/dynatrace.davis.anomalydetection/).

---

24.title: Host name

25.title: Filesystem usage

26.title: Network Connections
26.query:
timeseries max(system.network.connections), by: { host.name }, filter: { matchesValue(host.name, $Hosts) }
| fieldsAdd NetworkIO = arrayAvg(`max(system.network.connections)`)
